title: utility module
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/612

[kind.f90](/uploads/048e1ac51255da3d8509bab40439ed81/kind.f90)[util.f90](/uploads/98acafa844ba18474e54c9bfdd814a15/util.f90)[xutil.f90](/uploads/131416a4c07067b5c08b2107c582c6af/xutil.f90)[xxutil.f90](/uploads/dccfb5982bc54bf6abcf6285a493208f/xxutil.f90)

Over the years I have created a big module util_mod that has hundreds of procedures and which is used by hundreds of my programs. It does not compile because of some of the issues I reported earlier. I can compile both `kind.f90 util.f90 xutil.f90` and `kind.f90 util.f90 xxutil.f90` into executables with gfortran, g95, and Intel Fortran. The files are attached. Since they are proprietary I marked this issue confidential. When util.f90 can be compiled by LFortran I will be able to try it on hundreds of complete programs.
